Postgraduate History students see their wages slashed

History postgraduates feel that at times they are in a "three-year, poorly paid internship" (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: www.yorkgsa.org/)

University warned over future increase in numbers

YUSU has warned the University that many departments are now at "critical mass" and any further increase in student numbers might be to the detriment of York (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: carlos62)

Animal Rights group targets University

Animal Rights activists are planning to protest against the University's involvement in animal testing (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: DOPAMINEHARPER)

Review of the year: best and worst moments of 2011/12

By James Bithell

Nouse reviews some of the highlights of the year and casts its eye over the performance of the YUSU Sabbatical Officers (Thumbnail credit Image credit: Rose Troup Buchanan)

New YUSU media guidelines

YUSU has introduced social media guidelines for Union officers after a number of disputes and controversies concerning the use of Facebook and Twitter were raised in the past year (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: PSHAB)

Late history exams prompt complaints

First-year history students have voiced complaints about the late timetabling of a three hour closed exam, which took place last Monday

Isoc defends Yusuf Chambers event

It has emerged the University of York's Islamic Society failed to submit the appropriate approval forms required by the University in time, before hosting Yusuf Chambers last Wednesday (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Andy Davies)

Changes proposed for campus collegiate system

Research conducted by the University of York Students' Union has outlined key improvements that should be made to the collegiate system (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: CARLOS62)

Platinum or bronze? Society grading system introduced from next year

From autumn term next year societies will be graded and awarded according to their performance in areas such as: membership, collaboration, events, and fundraising (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Tom Witherow)

Heslington East horse evicted

The horse by Heslington East has been removed from University property following threats from the University of repossession

Memorial service held in Physics for "sorely missed" James student

A memorial service was held last Friday for Leyah Karodia, a fourth-year Physicist, who passed away in early April after an episode of illness

Library fines to be increased

The University Library customer services are proposing to increase fines and introduce changes to the book loan system from 3 September

YUSU Awards honours students

Last Friday the third annual YUSU Awards were held, celebrating those York students who have gone the extra mile to enhance the student experience at York

Funding Your Future

As another fundraising telethon campaign draws to a close, Rachel Banning-Lover talks to some of the student callers responsible for reconnecting alumni with their Alma Mater (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Agatha Torrance)

Chief Executive of YUSU resigns

The Chief Executive Officer of YUSU has resigned after handing in his resignation last week, Nouse has learnt

Turbulent league table rankings continue for York

The University of York has dropped two places in The Times Good University Guide league table, falling from 11th to 13th place

Islamic Society's event sparks controversy

YUSU defended the invitation of Yusuf Chambers to speak at the University on Wednesday evening amid controversy over the speaker's views on homosexuality

Scott Mills to headline NeverlanD

BBC Radio 1 DJ Scott Mills has been announced as the final headline at this year's NeverlanD event. Reverend and the Makers and Roll Deep are also set to perform. (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Derwent College)

York is Britain's best "rising star" university

Despite recent disappointing national university league table rankings, York has been placed eighth in an under-50 world league table

Concern over international academic misconduct cases

Academic misconduct cases continue to involve a "disproportionate number" of international students, despite the University having identified the problem in 2008 (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Aggie Torrance)

Agencies to publish full student addresses

Local letting agent criticises plans for a new law forcing companies to reveal students' full addresses (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Fabian pfaender)

Disabled student facilities placed on top floor

Concerns have been raised regarding the disabled facilities in the new Langwith buildings on the Heslington East campus (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Philippa Grafton)

YUSU LGBT proposes adding "Queer" to acronym

YUSU LGBT have announced their intention to add "Q" to their name (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Spinney Head)

Heslington's new Sport Village

By James Bithell

Philippa Grafton takes a tour around the new Langwith College and Sport Village (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Philippa Grafton)

Going against student stereotype: BAE motion fails

A motion to 'disarm York' has been rejected by students (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Philippa Grafton)

Students struggling to find space in library

Students are struggling to find space in the Library as students are saving places for friends arriving later and holding onto desks for long periods of time

The Heslington East story

The story behind the Heslington East campus (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: hardillb)

University apologises for the delay in publishing 2012 exam timetables

The University has come out and apologised for the late publication of this year's examination timetable after many students had voiced grievances about the delay (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Jack Hynes)

Students miscalculating units

The results of a survey, conducted by YUSU in the autumn, have revealed only half those who claimed to know the definition of a unit of alcohol, 10ml of pure ethanol, were correct (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Timbrauhn)

A history of activism?

As students voted against the BAE motion in the YUSU referendum last week, Neil Johnston examines the archives to see whether York has had an abundance of student activism (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: George Lowther)
